sen.j: 狩野 茂光（かの もちみつ、生年未詳 - 治承4年（1180年））は平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Mochimitsu KANO (date of birth unknown - 1180) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the end of Heian period.
Mochimitsu KANO (date of birth unknown - 1180) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the end of the Heian period.
Mochimitsu KANO (date of birth unknown - 1180) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 藤原南家の流れを汲む伊豆の有力豪族。
sen.e: He was a member of the local ruling family of the Izu province, which followed the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was a member of the local ruling family of Izu Province, who followed the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was a member of the local ruling family of Izu Province, who followed the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 勢力範囲は山がちではあったが、伊豆を代表する牧草地だった牧之郷を領有し良馬を多数有したため伊豆半島最大の勢力を築くこととなった。
sen.e: He possessed Makinogo which was a mountainous meadow representing Izu, owned a lot of good horses and wielded the largest influence over the Izu Peninsula.

Although most of the family's territory was mountains and hills, they established the greatest influence in the Izu Peninsula since they had Makinogo, a famous meadow of Izu, and a lot of good horses.

Although most of the family's territory was mountains and hills, they established the greatest influence in the Izu Peninsula since they had Makinogo, a famous meadow of Izu, and a lot of good horses.

sen.j: 工藤祐経、伊東祐親とは同族。
sen.e: He belonged to the same family as Suketsune KUDO and Sukechika ITO.
He belonged to the same family as Suketsune KUDO and Sukechika ITO.
He belonged to the same family as Suketsune KUDO and Sukechika ITO.
He was also called Shigemitsu KUDO.
He was also called Mochimitsu KUDO.
sen.cmt: 読み間違いです。登録単語は他人のことか、読み間違いです。
sen.e: He was also called Mochimitsu KUDO.

sen.j: 狩野宗茂、狩野行光、狩野親光の父。
sen.e: He was father of Munemochi KANO, Yukimitsu KANO and Chikamitsu KANO.
He was the father of Munemochi KANO, Yukimitsu KANO and Chikamitsu KANO.
He was the father of Munemochi KANO, Yukimitsu KANO and Chikamitsu KANO.

sen.j: 伊豆大島を所領としており、保元の乱（1156年）で大島に流罪となった源為朝の監視役となる。
sen.e: He had a territory of the Izu-oshima Island and oversaw MINAMOTO no Tametomo who exiled to the Izu-oshima Island.
The family's territory included the Izu-oshima Island; and when MINAMOTO no Tametomo was exiled to the Izu-oshima Island for the commitment to the Hogen War (1156), he was appointed the surveillance.
The family's territory included the Izu-oshima Island; and when MINAMOTO no Tametomo was exiled to the Izu-oshima Island for the commitment to the Hogen War (1156), he was appointed the surveillance.

sen.j: やがて為朝が流人の身でありながら周辺諸豪族を切り従えて自立の動きを見せたため、嘉応2年（1170年）にこれを追討し自害に追い込んでいる。
sen.e: Since Tametomo led local ruling families in nearby areas and tried to get independent though he was an exile, he was hunted down and forced to commit suicide in 1170.
Later Tametomo, who was still an exile, raised an army and led the local ruling families of the nearby areas to become independent, so Mochimitsu hunted him and forced him to commit suicide in 1170.
Later Tametomo, who was still an exile, raised an army and led the local ruling families of the nearby areas to become independent, so Mochimitsu hunted him and forced him to commit suicide in 1170.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）、同じく伊豆国において流人生活を送っていた源頼朝が反平家の兵を挙げるとその足下に駆けつけ、石橋山の戦いで平家方の大庭景親・伊東祐親らと交戦。
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who was exiled in the Izu province raised an army to fight with Heike, Mochimitsu KANO joined him and fought with Kagechika OBA and Sukechika ITO on the Taira family side in the Battle o Ishibashiyama.

In 1180, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who had been also exiled to Izu Province raised an army to fight against Heike (the Taira family), Mochimitsu joined him and fought against Kagechika OBA and Sukechika ITO who supported the Taira family in the Battle of Ishibashiyama.

In 1180, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who had been also exiled to Izu Province raised an army to fight against Heike (the Taira family), Mochimitsu joined him and fought against Kagechika OBA and Sukechika ITO who supported the Taira family in the Battle of Ishibashiyama.

sen.j: この戦いに敗れ、自害して果てた。
sen.e: He was defeated in this battle and killed himself.
He was defeated in this battle and killed himself.
He was defeated in this battle and killed himself.

sen.j: 一説には、茂光は肥満体であったため思うように走ることができず、周囲の足手まといになることを嫌い、孫の田代信綱に懇願して介錯されたともいう。
sen.e: There is a theory that says that Mochimitsu was fat and could not run fast, hated to be a drag and asked his grandson Nobutsuna TASHIRO to assist him in committing hara-kiri by beheading him.
There is a theory that says that Mochimitsu was fat and could not run fast, hated to be a drag and asked his grandson Nobutsuna TASHIRO to assist him in committing hara-kiri by beheading him.
There is a theory that says that Mochimitsu was fat and could not run fast, hated to be a drag and asked his grandson Nobutsuna TASHIRO to assist him in committing hara-kiri by beheading him.

sen.j: 狩野氏は古代から小田原征伐にいたるまで 武家として活躍し、末裔が現代まで伊豆に多数残り、伊豆名門の一つである。
sen.e: The Kano clan flourished from ancient times to the conquest and siege of Odawara, has a lot of descendants in Izu and is one of the families of pedigree.
The Kano clan flourished from the Nara period to the conquest of Odawara as samurai family, and was one of the good families of Izu, and their descendants are still living in Izu at the present day.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れがあります。「古代」は日本史の用語で奈良・平安時代のことです。
sen.e: The Kano clan flourished from the Nara period to the conquest of Odawara as samurai family, and was one of the good families of Izu, and their descendants are still living in Izu at the present day.
